nodes.bodyText: Frequencies.txt is a standard part of GTFS so if it is not supported in OTP2 this probably deserves to be more than a footnote - although GTFS for big networks often uses purely scheduled trips, some people working with other GTFS inputs may be confused or waste time if their frequency trips are not imported.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -54,6 +54,8 @@ When in doubt, new users are advised to try out OTP2 and switch to OTP1 if they
 | Transfer Priority | yes (route, trip, stop level) | no (planned) |
 / REST API format | XML, JSON | JSON only |
 
+[1] [Trip Frequency is not working in OTP 2.0.](https://github.com/opentripplanner/OpenTripPlanner/issues/3243)

nodes.bodyText: Rather than a footnote I'd instead inline the comment here: yes (frequencies.txt not yet supported)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -32,7 +32,7 @@ When in doubt, new users are advised to try out OTP2 and switch to OTP1 if they
 | Feature | OTP1 | OTP2 |
 |---------|------|------|
 | OSM street data | yes | yes |
-| GTFS transit data | yes | yes |
+| GTFS transit data | yes | yes[1] |
